course.subject: ENVS
course.name: Environmental Microbiology
course.description: The course aims to introduce the students to (i) the fundamental features of microorganisms that live in the natural environment, (ii) the roles of the microorganisms in natural processes that drive our ecosystem, such as biogeochemical cycling, interactions with plants and animals, (iii) the use of the microorganisms in environmental technology. Key concepts are illustrated with real-life examples and case studies.
course.prerequisites: LIFS 1030 OR LIFS 2060

reviews.author: Nandi
reviews.comment_content:
The course is divided into two parts. The first part is taught by Stanley, which focuses on the basics of microbiology.

1. Introduction to Environmental Microbiology
2. Microbial diversity in the environment  
3. Microbial structures and their functions in the environment
4. Microbial nutrition, metabolism and physiology
5. Quorum sensing: bacterial communication
6. Biofilms: bacterial multicellularity
7. Antibiotics: bacterial competition
8. Environmental microorganisms and human diseases
9. Monitoring of microbiological quality of water resources

Yung Charmaine's content was a lot easier. Less technical, more memorization.

1. Biogeochemical cycling
2. C - Cycle
3. N - cycle
4. P & S - Cycle
5. Microbes and climate change
reviews.comment_teaching:
Stanley's lectures are quite fun to attend and he is a good teacher. The topics he delves into are pretty complex, especially after the midterm. He encourages students to think in classes rather than just read off the powerpoint. He gives a lot of information in class, so go for the lecture.

Yung's lectures are a lot easier and are mostly based on memorization. Her lectures aren't as fun as Stanley's and she hesitates a lot while speaking.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal Grading System
1. Midterm 45 %
2. Final Exam - 50 %
3. PPT presentation - 5%

Amended Grading System for Fall 19-20
1. Mid Term - 50%
       Mean 27.7 / 50
2. 3 page final project + PPT - 50%

The midterm had both MCQs and essay type questions. The exam requires a lot of logical thinking rather than memorization.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite light for a 3000 level course. There is no attendance or assignment. Just the Midterm, final and presentation.

PS: I would recommend students to take notes in Stanley's classes since he gives a lot of extra info and he will questions on that in the exam.

reviews.author: DeadAirForever!
reviews.title: Overall is a good and interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches things about microorganisms, mainly bacteria, from their structures, functions of each structures, their involvement and functions in natural processes, namely carbon cycle, nitro cycle and phosphorus cycle, to some issues such as antibiotic resistance and climate change.

Topics taught in this course:
1. Introduction of Environmental Microbiology
2.  Biodiversity and taxonomy
3.  Structure and function of microorganisms
4.  Growth, nutrients and metabolism of microorganisms
5.  Microbial interactions –antagonism
6.  Microbial interactions -biofilms
7.  Microbial interactions –cooperation
8.  Biogeochemical cycling
9.  Carbon cycle
10. Nitrogen cycle
11. Phosphorus cycle
12. Microbes and climate change
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite interesting and easy to understand for the parts thats taught by Prof. Lau. Although he may provide some reading material for you, all these will not be examined.

Want to gave E for the second part that taught by Prof. Yung  as it is very bored and difficult to understand. It seems like she doesn't know about the topics (i.e. biogeochemical cycling, carbon cycle, nitrogen cycle, phosphorus cycle, microbes and climate change).
Many unnatural pauses, 'um', and only say few more sentences after reading each the slide word by word.
Overall, she makes things become very complicated and messy that you will not be able to know what she is saying and what main point even though watching the lecture videos for many times!!! Although she usually reply your email quickly and with detailed explanation, to be honest, this doesn't help much!
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighing:
1. Midterm examination (40 %)
2. Final examination (40 %)
3. On-line class presentation (10 %) + written report (10 %)

My Grade (for reference only):
20/20 for the presentation and the written report
31/40 for midterm
29/40 for final (most marks that are lost in this final, are those topics that taught by Prof. Yung, so you can see...)
Overall, got A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
1. A presentation (need to submit the PPT)
2. An individual written report that is related to the
    presentation (in short article format)
3. Midterm
4. Final

For the presentation is a 3-minutes individual presentation and can only use 3 slides (slide 1: problem, slide 2: A concept, principle or a specific area of knowledge in environmental microbiology, slide 3: own innovative idea in using the concept/principle/knowledge in slide 2 to solve the problem in slide 1), follow-up questions (usually 1-2) will be asked/ comments may be provided)

While the report is used to elaborate the content in short article format with no more than 2000 words, all sources used in the report need citations.

For the midterm and final, it is important to clear all the concepts, and memorize some key points such as some features & metabolisms of particular microorganisms.
